intro: Dissochaeta celebica var. celebica, commonly known as the Celebes dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This species typically grows in moist, tropical environments, often found in lowland areas with rich soil. The plant features slender, erect stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in local ecosystems and botanical studies.
